ground_truth: Flash glares as Peter walks out of the swing doors, causing a tray to be trapped on the swing shot. Later, Peter strides towards his locker, examining his wrist as he goes. Flash marches after him, pushing students out of his way. Peter stands staring at his unopened locker when he hears a paper airplane zooming down the corridor towards a fly hovering by the fire alarm bell. In slow motion, he hears a spit wad being propelled from a blowpipe, followed by a fist. He swerves to his side as Flash's punch lands on the locker door. Flash, using his left hand, aims two punches at Peter, who dodges them. Then, in slow motion, Flash throws another punch, which Peter narrowly avoids. A punching white follows, and Peter arches his back as if doing a limbo dance to evade it. To avoid Flash's colleague, Peter flips into the air, somersaults, and lands on his feet. Flash charges again but fails to connect. Peter grabs Flash's arm, then punches him. Flash slides on his back down the corridor, collides with a teacher carrying a tray, and ends up with more food on him. MJ looks at him in wonder, Flash's crony and Harry seem awestruck, MJ is unsure, and Peter looks confused and a little frightened. He races off, running across a street intersection and coming to a gateway leading into an alley. Out of sight of passersby on the sidewalk, he scrutinizes his wrist where the web shot from, then turns over his hand to examine the swollen bite mark. He looks up and sees a spider's web woven around the coils of barbed wire above the gateway entrance and moves his hands closer to his face, noticing barbed bristles beginning to grow on the pads of his fingertips. Peter stares at the brick building behind him and, placing his hands on the surface, starts to climb. With ease, Peter scales the high-sided brick building, his fingertips almost sticking to the surface. Halfway up, he stops and looks down. Peter runs across the roofs of tall buildings, leaping across the gaps between them. Two children playing with a skipping rope are oblivious as Peter launches himself into the air above their heads. He lands on another roof and comes to a halt at the edge, once again scrutinizing his wrist. Opposite him, across the road, is a crane. Peter thinks for a moment, then loops from his wrist to the crane, thrusting his arm forward towards the jib.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Flash is glared at by cameras as Peter walks out of the swing doors, causing a tray to be trapped on the swing shot. Later, his locker is approached by Peter, who examines his wrist as he goes. Flash marches after him, pushing students out of his way. Peter stands staring at his unopened locker when he hears a paper airplane zooming down the corridor towards a fly hovering by the fire alarm bell. In slow motion, a spit wad is heard by him being propelled from a blowpipe, followed by a fist. He swerves to his side as the locker door is landed on by Flash's punch. Flash, using his left hand, aims two punches at Peter, dodged by him. Then, in slow motion, another punch is thrown by Flash, narrowly avoided by Peter. A punching white follows, and his back is arched by Peter as if doing a limbo dance to evade it. To avoid Flash's colleague, the air is flipped into by Peter, somersaults, and lands on his feet. Flash charges again but fails to connect. Flash's arm is grabbed by Peter, then he punches him. Flash slides on his back down the corridor, collides with a teacher carrying a tray, and ends up with more food on him. Him is looked at in wonder by MJ, Flash's crony and Harry seem awestruck, MJ is unsure, and confusion and a little fright are shown by Peter. He races off, running across a street intersection and coming to a gateway leading into an alley. Out of sight of passersby on the sidewalk, his wrist is scrutinized by him where the web shot from, then his hand is turned over by him to examine the swollen bite mark. A spider's web woven around the coils of barbed wire above the gateway entrance is looked up at by him, and he moves his hands closer to his face, noticing barbed bristles beginning to grow on the pads of his fingertips. The brick building behind him is stared at by Peter and, placing his hands on the surface, the climb is started by him. With ease, the high-sided brick building is scaled by Peter, his fingertips almost sticking to the surface. Halfway up, he stops and looks down. The roofs of tall buildings are run across by Peter, who leaps across the gaps between them. Two children playing with a skipping rope are oblivious as the air above their heads is launched into by Peter. Another roof is landed on by him, and the edge is approached by him, once again his wrist is scrutinized by him. Opposite him, across the road, is a crane. For a moment, Peter thinks, then loops from his wrist to the crane, his arm is thrust forward by him towards the jib.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Flash glares as Peter exits the swing doors, causing a tray to get stuck. Later, Peter walks to his locker, glancing at his wrist. Flash follows, shoving students aside. Peter is staring at his locker when a paper airplane zooms by. In slow motion, he notices a spit wad from a blowpipe followed by a punch. He dodges, and Flash's punch hits the locker. Flash throws more punches, but Peter evades them, narrowly avoiding a punch by arching back. To dodge Flash's ally, Peter flips into the air and lands on his feet. Flash charges but misses, and Peter counters, sending Flash sliding into a teacher. Flash ends up with food on him. MJ is amazed, Flash's friend and Harry are impressed, while MJ is unsure and Peter seems confused and scared. He quickly exits, crossing a street and reaching an alley. Out of sight, he examines his wrist where the web came from and inspects a bite mark. Noticing a spider's web above, he sees bristles growing on his fingertips. Peter then climbs a brick building effortlessly. Midway, he pauses to look down, then continues across rooftops, leaping gaps. Two children skip rope, oblivious to Peter flying above them. He lands, examines his wrist again, spots a crane, and shoots a loop of web toward it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Flash blinds Peter as he exits swing doors, trapping a tray. He checks his wrist heading to his locker. Flash shoves students to reach Peter, who hears a paper airplane zooming towards a fly by the fire alarm bell. In slow motion, a spit wad and fist approach; Peter dodges, and Flash's punch hits the locker. Flash aims two more punches, missed by Peter. In slow motion, Flash's punch is narrowly avoided. Peter arches back to evade another punch, flips into the air, somersaults, and lands. Flash misses again; Peter grabs and punches him, sending Flash sliding into a teacher, covering him in food. MJ, Flash's crony, and Harry look in awe; MJ is unsure, Peter confused and frightened. He runs to an alley, checks his wrist, hand, and bite mark. He sees a spider's web on barbed wire, notices bristles on his fingertips, touches the bricks behind, and climbs easily. Midway, he looks down, then runs across roofs, jumping gaps, unnoticed by children. He stops at an edge, checks his wrist, sees a crane, and loops from his wrist, aiming forward towards the jib.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As Peter confidently steps through the swing doors, the harsh flash of the camera temporarily blinds him, causing him to lose focus momentarily and causing a tray to get trapped in the arc of the swinging door. Eventually, Peter makes his way towards his locker, attentively examining his wrist as he walks, each step deliberate and steady. Meanwhile, Flash follows closely behind him, marching with determination and shoving any students who happen to be obstructing his path. As Peter stands, frozen and contemplative, in front of his unopened locker, his attention is caught by a paper airplane zooming through the corridor, heading straight for a fly that is hovering persistently near the fire alarm bell. Suddenly, in a surreal slow-motion sequence, Peter registers the distinct sound of a spit wad being propelled from a blowpipe, shortly followed by the whoosh of an incoming fist. Swiftly, he swerves to the side just in time to see Flash's punch land forcefully against the locker door. Flash, not deterred, uses his left hand to aim two more punches at Peter, who manages to dodge them with great agility. Then, in another slow-motion moment, Flash throws yet another punch, which Peter narrowly manages to evade. Following a rapid punch thrown with a white-knuckled fist, Peter arches his back with grace, as though performing an intricate limbo dance, to avoid it. In a deft maneuver to evade Flash's associate, Peter flips into the air, executing a somersault before landing gracefully on his feet. Undeterred, Flash charges at him once more but ultimately fails to make contact. In a swift motion, Peter skillfully grabs Flash's arm, then lands a punch squarely on him. Flash slides backward on his back down the corridor, colliding with a teacher who is carrying a tray, and ends up comically covered in more food. MJ observes the scene in wonder, while Flash's sidekick and Harry appear completely awestruck. MJ remains uncertain, and Peter finds himself both perplexed and slightly frightened by the unfolding events. He quickly departs from the scene, sprinting across a busy street intersection and finally reaching a gateway leading into a secluded alleyway. Hidden from the view of the passersby strolling along the main sidewalk, he scrutinizes his wrist intently, examining the spot where the web was shot from, then carefully turns his hand over to observe the swollen bite mark closely. Looking upwards, he notices a spider's web intricately woven around the coils of barbed wire above the gateway entrance. Curiously, he moves his hands closer to his face, noticing with astonishment the emergence of barbed bristles beginning to sprout on the pads of his fingertips. Peter, filled with determination, turns his gaze to the brick building behind him, and with caution, places his hands on the surface, beginning to climb with an almost effortless grace. With remarkable ease, Peter scales the towering brick building, his fingertips seeming to adhere to the surface as if by magic. When he reaches the halfway point, he pauses momentarily to look down at the ground below. Peter then embarks on an exhilarating journey over the rooftops of lofty buildings, bounding across the gaps between them with breathtaking leaps. Two children, immersed in play with a skipping rope, remain blissfully unaware as Peter launches himself into the air above their heads. He lands securely on yet another rooftop and stops at the very edge, once again examining his wrist with keen interest. Directly across the road from him stands an imposing crane. As Peter contemplates his next move, he makes the decision to loop a web from his wrist towards the crane, thrusting his arm forward decisively towards the crane's jib.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As Peter strides with confidence through the swing doors, a sudden and harsh flash from a camera catches him off guard, temporarily blinding him. This unexpected moment causes him to momentarily lose his focus, resulting in a tray becoming trapped in the arc of the swinging door. After regaining his composure, Peter resolutely makes his way toward his locker, all the while attentively checking his wrist as he walks, with each step being deliberate and steady. Meanwhile, Flash follows closely behind him with determination, forcefully pushing aside any students who happen to stand in his path. As Peter stands there, frozen in a contemplative state, in front of his still-unopened locker, his attention is abruptly diverted by a paper airplane darting through the bustling corridor, on a direct course toward a fly that is persistently hovering near the fire alarm bell.

Suddenly, in an oddly surreal slow-motion sequence, Peter hears the distinct sound of a spit wad being shot from a blowpipe, quickly followed by the whoosh of an impending fist. With quick reflexes, he deftly swerves to the side just in time to witness Flash's punch land forcefully against the locker door. Unfazed, Flash uses his left hand to throw two more punches aimed at Peter, who skillfully dodges them with remarkable agility. Then, in yet another slow-motion moment, Flash throws another punch, which Peter narrowly manages to evade. Following this rapid punch, which is propelled with a tightly clenched, white-knuckled fist, Peter gracefully arches his back, resembling an intricate limbo dance, to avoid the blow.

In a swift and deft maneuver to avoid Flash's sidekick, Peter executes an impressive flip into the air, completing a somersault before landing back on his feet with remarkable grace. Undeterred by this, Flash charges at him once more, but ultimately fails to make any contact. In a swift and fluid motion, Peter expertly grabs Flash's arm and delivers a punch squarely on him. Flash slides backward on his back down the corridor, colliding dramatically with a teacher who is carrying a tray, and ends up comically covered in an array of food. MJ, observing the unfolding scene, is filled with wonder, while Flash's sidekick and Harry stand completely awestruck by the events transpiring before them. MJ remains uncertain, and Peter finds himself both perplexed and slightly frightened by what is happening. Quickly, he exits the chaotic scene, sprinting across a bustling street intersection and finally reaching the entrance of a secluded alleyway.

Once hidden from the view of passersby who are strolling along the busy main sidewalk, he scrutinizes his wrist intently, examining the precise spot from where the web was shot. Then, with care, he turns his hand over to observe the swollen bite mark closely. Looking upwards, he notices a spider's web intricately woven around the barbed wire coils above the entrance to the alleyway. Curiously, he brings his hands closer to his face, noticing with astonishment that barbed bristles are beginning to sprout on the pads of his fingertips. Filled with determination, Peter then turns his gaze towards the brick building behind him and, with caution, places his hands on its surface, beginning to climb with a seemingly effortless grace. With remarkable ease, Peter ascends the towering brick building, his fingertips appearing to adhere to the surface as if by some magical force. When he reaches the halfway point, he pauses momentarily to gaze down at the ground below.

Peter then embarks on an exhilarating adventure, leaping across the rooftops of towering buildings, bounding over the gaps between them with breathtaking jumps. Two children below, deeply engrossed in their play with a skipping rope, remain blissfully unaware as Peter launches himself into the air above their heads. He lands securely on yet another rooftop, stopping at the very edge, and once again examines his wrist with keen interest. Directly across the road from his vantage point stands an imposing crane. As Peter ponders his next move, he decisively makes the choice to loop a web from his wrist towards the crane, thrusting his arm forward with determination towards the jib of the crane.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Peter pushes through the swing doors, a flash of light momentarily blinds him, inadvertently causing him to trap a tray within the swinging motion of the door. Gradually adjusting to his surroundings, he begins to stride towards his locker, casting occasional glances at his wrist along the way. Meanwhile, Flash emerges from behind, determinedly marching forward and forcibly pushing aside students in his path, intent on catching up to Peter. Peter reaches his locker and pauses, standing still and contemplating the unopened door when a subtle noise captures his attention. He turns his head slightly to identify a paper airplane zipping down the corridor, targeting a fly hovering near the fire alarm bell. Simultaneously, his heightened senses detect the slow-motion trajectory of a spit wad launched from a blowpipe, soon followed by the swift movement of a fist. Instinctively, Peter pivots to his side just as Flash’s punch slams against the locker door, missing him by a margin. Flash, undeterred, attempts two more punches with his left hand, which Peter deftly evades by slightly shifting his position. Then, as Flash winds up another punch, time seems to slow, and Peter narrowly dodges the blow. A subsequent punch careens towards him, prompting Peter to arch his back gracefully in a limbo-like movement to avoid it. With nimble agility, Peter flips into the air, executing a somersault before landing squarely on his feet to avoid the approach of Flash's colleague. Flash lunges once more, his effort thwarted as Peter skillfully steps aside. Seizing the opportunity, Peter firmly grasps Flash's arm, delivering a precise punch that sends Flash sliding down the corridor. The momentum propels Flash into a teacher burdened with a tray, culminating in a comical collision that leaves Flash covered in food. Observers react: MJ looks on with wonder, Flash’s crony and Harry seem astounded, MJ remains unsure, and Peter himself appears confused and slightly frightened. Reacting swiftly, Peter dashes away, racing across a bustling street intersection and arriving at a gateway leading into a secluded alley. Hidden from the view of pedestrians, he intensely examines his wrist, curious about the origin of the web shot, and scrutinizes the swollen bite mark on the back of his hand. His gaze shifts upwards to notice a spider's web intricately woven around barbed wire coils above the gateway, prompting him to bring his hands closer to his face, observing the emergence of barbed bristles growing on his fingertips. Curiosity piqued, Peter turns his attention to the brick wall behind him, and, with a sense of daring, places his hands on the rough surface. Remarkably, he begins climbing the high-sided brick building with effortless ease, noticing how his fingertips adhere to the surface. Reaching halfway up, he pauses to look down, contemplating the height he has achieved. Energized, Peter resumes his ascent, eventually running across the roofs of tall buildings with remarkable speed and agility, leaping across gaps between them. Two children, engrossed in their game of skipping rope, remain blissfully unaware as Peter soars through the air above them. He lands seamlessly on another rooftop, halting at the edge to once again scrutinize his wrist. His eyes drift across the street, settling on a crane. Pondering his next move, Peter focuses intently, generating a web loop from his wrist aimed at the crane, and with a decisive thrust, propels his arm forward towards the crane’s jib.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Peter exits through the swing doors, inadvertently trapping a tray, and strides toward his locker while checking his wrist. Flash bulldozes through students in pursuit. As Peter pauses at his locker, a paper airplane and spit wad drift by in slow motion, followed by Flash's attack. Peter deftly dodges Flash's punches, including a slow-motion swing, arching back to evade like a limbo dancer. He flips into the air to avoid another assailant, somersaulting to his feet. Flash charges again, but Peter counters by grabbing his arm and delivering a punch, sending Flash sliding into a teacher with a tray. Amidst the chaos, MJ, Flash's crony, and Harry are awestruck, while Peter feels confused and alarmed. 

Peter races off, crosses an intersection, and slips into an alley. Out of sight, he examines his wrist and the swollen bite mark. Seeing a spider’s web above, he notices bristles growing on his fingertips. Inspired, he tests his grip on a brick wall and begins effortlessly scaling it. High above, Peter glances down and then dashes across rooftops, leaping across gaps. Unseen by children below, he sails over them, landing on another rooftop where he pauses, again inspecting his wrist. Spotting a crane across the street, Peter formulates a plan and extends his arm, shooting a web towards the crane's jib.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
As Peter steps out into the blinding sunlight with flash glares from the cameras of curious students, he inadvertently causes a tray to become lodged in the swing shot of the bustling school cafeteria doors. Later, as he makes his way to his locker, he glances at his wrist, the site of a mysterious spider bite he received during a recent field trip to the local genetics lab, which specializes in radioactive research. Flash, the notorious school bully known for his aggressive antics, follows close behind, shoving fellow students aside as he approaches.

Peter stands motionless in front of his still-closed locker, when he catches sight of a paper airplane darting down the corridor, aimed at a housefly circling by the fire alarm bell. In that moment, time seems to crawl as he hears the unmistakable sound of a spit wad launched from a clandestine blowpipe, followed quickly by the whoosh of a fist. He deftly pivots aside, narrowly avoiding Flash's punch that crashes into his locker door.

Flash, determined and using his formidable left hand, swings two more punches at Peter, who expertly evades each one. As if in a slow-motion dance, Flash throws yet another punch, but Peter skillfully ducks just in time. A white-knuckled punch follows, prompting Peter to arch his back low like a limbo dancer, dodging gracefully. Faced with another assailant, one of Flash's accomplices, Peter somersaults into the air, landing neatly on his feet. Flash, undeterred, charges once more but fails to make contact as Peter deftly grasps his arm, countering with a swift punch that sends Flash sliding on his back down the corridor. This slide concludes with Flash colliding with a teacher laden with a cafeteria tray, resulting in a mess of food across his clothes.

MJ, a fellow student renowned for her intelligence and beauty, gazes at the scene in wonder, while Flash's crony and Harry, Peter's best friend, appear awestruck. Amid the confusion, MJ is uncertain, and Peter seems both bewildered and slightly frightened by his newfound abilities. Hastily, he dashes away, sprinting across a busy street intersection to reach the gateway of a secluded alley. Here, hidden from the view of pedestrians, he inspects his wrist, curious about the source of the web that recently shot from it. As he flips his hand over, he examines the now-pulsating bite mark. His eyes drift upward to a spider's web intricately woven around the sharp coils of barbed wire above the entrance, a reminder of the transformative event at the lab.

Noticing barbed bristles sprouting on his fingertips, Peter turns his attention to the brick building behind him. Placing his hands on its surface, he begins to climb almost instinctively. With surprising ease and seeming adhesion, Peter scales the towering brick edifice, his fingers appearing to cling effortlessly to the surface. Pausing midway, he glances down at the dizzying height below. With determination, Peter takes off across the rooftops of towering city buildings, seamlessly leaping across the chasms between them. Unbeknownst to two children below, busily skipping rope on the sidewalk, Peter soars through the air above their heads.

Landing on yet another roof, Peter halts at the precipice to once more examine his wrist, pondering the strange gift he has received. Across the road stands a crane, its long arm extending high into the sky. After a moment of contemplation, Peter instinctively shoots a web loop from his wrist aimed at the crane's jib, thrusting his arm forward with newfound purpose and precision.

Flash marches after him pushing students out of his way. Peter stands staring at his unopened locker when he hears a paper airplane zooming down the corridor towards a fly hovering by the fire alarm bell. In slow motion he hears a spit wad being propelled from a blowpipe followed by a fist. He swerves to his side as Flash's punch lands on the locker door. Flash charges again but fails to connect. Peter grabs Flash's arm then punches him. Flash slides on his back down the corridor collides with a teacher carrying a tray and ends up with more food on him. MJ looks at him in wonder. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Flash's crony and Harry seem awestruck. MJ is unsure and Peter looks confused and a little frightened. He races off running across a street intersection and coming to a gateway leading into an alley. Out of sight of passersby on the sidewalk he scrutinizes his wrist where the web shot from. then turns over his hand to examine the swollen bite mark. He looks up and sees a spider's web woven around the coils of barbed wire above the gateway entrance and moves his hands closer to his face noticing barbed bristles beginning to grow on the pads of his fingertips. Peter stares at the brick building behind him and placing his hands on the surface starts to climb. With ease Peter scales the highsided brick building his fingertips almost sticking to the surface. Halfway up he stops and looks down. Peter runs across the roofs of tall buildings leaping across the gaps between them. Two children playing with a skipping rope are oblivious as Peter launches himself into the air above their heads. He lands on another roof and comes to a halt at the edge once again scrutinizing his wrist. Opposite him across the road is a crane. Peter thinks for a moment then loops from his wrist to the crane thrusting his arm forward towards the jib.

During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. Flash's crony and Harry seem awestruck. MJ is unsure and Peter looks confused and a little frightened. He races off running across a street intersection and coming to a gateway leading into an alley. Out of sight of passersby on the sidewalk he scrutinizes his wrist where the web shot from. then turns over his hand to examine the swollen bite mark. He looks up and sees a spider's web woven around the coils of barbed wire above the gateway entrance and moves his hands closer to his face noticing barbed bristles beginning to grow on the pads of his fingertips. Peter stares at the brick building behind him and placing his hands on the surface starts to climb. With ease Peter scales the highsided brick building his fingertips almost sticking to the surface. Halfway up he stops and looks down. Peter runs across the roofs of tall buildings leaping across the gaps between them. Two children playing with a skipping rope are oblivious as Peter launches himself into the air above their heads. He lands on another roof and comes to a halt at the edge once again scrutinizing his wrist. Opposite him across the road is a crane. Peter thinks for a moment then loops from his wrist to the crane thrusting his arm forward towards the jib.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Flash glares as Peter walks out of the swing doors causing a tray to be trapped on the swing shot. Later Peter strides towards his locker examining his wrist as he goes. Flash marches after him pushing students out of his way. Peter stands staring at his unopened locker when he hears a paper airplane zooming down the corridor towards a fly hovering by the fire alarm bell. In slow motion he hears a spit wad being propelled from a blowpipe followed by a fist. He swerves to his side as Flash's punch lands on the locker door. Flash using his left hand aims two punches at Peter who dodges them. With ease Peter scales the highsided brick building his fingertips almost sticking to the surface. Halfway up he stops and looks down. Peter runs across the roofs of tall buildings leaping across the gaps between them. Two children playing with a skipping rope are oblivious as Peter launches himself into the air above their heads. He lands on another roof and comes to a halt at the edge once again scrutinizing his wrist. Opposite him across the road is a crane. Peter thinks for a moment then loops from his wrist to the crane thrusting his arm forward towards the jib.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Flash glares as Peter walks out of the swing doors causing a tray to be trapped on the swing shot. Later Peter strides towards his locker examining his wrist as he goes. Flash marches after him pushing students out of his way. He lands on another roof and comes to a halt at the edge once again scrutinizing his wrist. Opposite him across the road is a crane. Peter thinks for a moment then loops from his wrist to the crane thrusting his arm forward towards the jib.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Blinding flashes ignite as Tom trudges out of the revolving gates, leading a bucket to be tossed on the spinning utensil. Later, Tom ambles towards his backpack, peering at his ankle as he proceeds. Greg stomps after him, nudging trees out of his path. Tom stands gawking at his closed backpack when he hears a kite soaring through the hallway towards a bee buzzing by the fire extinguisher. In slow motion, he hears a pebble being catapulted from a rubber band, followed by a foot. He zigzags to his side as Greg's foot lands on the backpack flap. Greg, using his right foot, aims two kicks at Tom, who dodges them. Then, in slow motion, Greg sends another kick, which Tom narrowly avoids. A swinging shoe follows, and Tom arches his back as if performing a yoga pose to evade it. To dodge Greg's companion, Tom flips into the air, twirls, and lands on his feet. Greg rushes again but misses. Tom seizes Greg's leg, then kicks him. Greg slides on his belly down the hallway, collides with a janitor holding a bucket, and ends up with more soap on him. Liz looks at him in disbelief, Greg's sidekick and Jake appear astonished, Liz is indecisive, and Tom looks bewildered and slightly alarmed. He dashes off, sprinting across a crosswalk and arriving at an archway leading into a tunnel. Out of sight of shoppers on the pavement, he examines his ankle where the cotton burst from, then turns over his foot to inspect the swollen sting mark. He looks up and sees a wasp's nest encircling the spirals of razor wire above the archway entrance and moves his feet closer to his eyes, noticing thorny spikes beginning to sprout on the tips of his toes. Tom stares at the wooden fence behind him and, placing his feet on the surface, starts to ascend. With ease, Tom scales the tall wooden fence, his toes almost sticking to the surface. Halfway up, he halts and looks down. Tom sprints across the canopies of tall trees, leaping across the gaps between them. Two dogs playing with a frisbee are unaware as Tom catapults himself into the air above their heads. He lands on another canopy and pauses at the edge, once again examining his ankle. Opposite him, across the river, is a tower. Tom ponders for a moment, then loops from his ankle to the tower, thrusting his leg forward towards the beam.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Peter exits through swing doors, causing a tray mishap. He heads to his locker, aware of Flash approaching aggressively. Avoiding Flash's punch, Peter dodges in a slow-motion sequence, evading punches with agility, performing flips, and landing safely. During the scuffle, Peter counters, sending Flash sliding into a teacher, ending up covered in food. Observers, including MJ, are amazed, while Peter feels confused and fearful. He escapes, examining his wrist where webbing emerged and a swollen bite mark. Noticing bristles on his fingertips, Peter climbs a brick building effortlessly. He runs across rooftops, leaping between them, astonishingly agile. Pausing to check his wrist, he sees a crane and considers using his newfound abilities.
